result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert E Pleadwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 13CF701.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Any restitution to be taken from prison funds.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Not be located on the property of any pawn shops or any like business.  Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SC.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Due to def's successful completion of the Earned Release Program on 10/26/18, court orders DOC to effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this Order.
Request from DOC to convert inmates remaining confinement time to extended supervision; inmate has completed the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: regarding Modification of Conditions of ES.  The Court finds that no legal authority has been cited in support of the requested relief and the requested relief is not in the public interest.  The requested relief is DENIED - The reasonableness of the goals of the ES conditions remains.
Reporter: Heather Kieta - Sentencing Hearing on Revocation on 8-1-2014
